chapter.title: Emergency ZSK Rollover (Published and Current ZSK Compromise)

para.emphasis: If the KSK is also compromised, perform the emergency KSK rollover first.

chapter.para: The emergency procedures described for key rollover use the rationale that injection of valid but false data (which can be generated using the compromised key) is more serious than discontinuity in our ability to validate true data. Thus, during emergency ZSK rollover, there will be a period (up to twice the maximum zone TTL) where the cached zone data may not validate against the new ZSK.
The DNSSEC-Tools utilities do not currently handle emergency KSK rollover. However, the utilities may be used to automate some of the steps required.

section.title: Emergency Current and Published ZSK Rollover Using DNSSEC-Tools
section.para: The steps given below detail the steps that must be taken during emergency ZSK rollover when using DNSSEC-Tools to assist in rollover.

section.title: Stop Automatic Zone Rollover
section.para: The rollerd command must not be executing during this procedure.

section.title: Generate New Current and Published Keys
section.para: Creating new Current and Published ZSKs may be done with a single zonesigner execution.

section.title: Fix the Keyrec File
section.para: The zonesigner command in the previous step will have left the compromised zone's keyrec file in an inconsistent state. Consequently, the keyrec file must be edited to return it to a valid state.
The steps below should be followed to fix the keyrec file for the Current ZSK keys.

listitem.para: Find the name of the zone's keyrec file. This may be done with the following command:
Find the name of the zone's Current ZSK signing set. Look for the zone keyrec entry for the compromised zone, and find its zskcur entry. This holds the name of the Current ZSK signing set.

Get the names of the keys in the Current ZSK signing set. Look for the set keyrec entry for the Current ZSK signing set. The keys listed in that set's keys entry are the ZSK keys in the Current ZSK signing set.
Edit the keyrec file and search for all key keyrec entries with a keyrec_type of "zskcur". Any keys with this type that are not in the Current signing set should be given the type "zskobs".

section.para: The steps below should be followed to fix the keyrec file for the Published KSK keys.

listitem.para: Find the name of the zone's keyrec file. This may be done with the following command:
Find the name of the zone's Published signing set. Look for the zone keyrec entry for the compromised zone, and find its zskpub entry. This holds the name of the Published ZSK signing set.

Get the names of the keys in the Published signing set. Look for the set keyrec entry for the Published ZSK signing set. The keys listed in that set's keys entry are the ZSK keys in the Published ZSK signing set.
Edit the keyrec file and search for all key keyrec entries with a keyrec_type of "zskpub". Any keys with this type that are not in the Published signing set should be given the type "zskobs".

section.title: Reload the Zone
section.para: The rndc will reload the name server configuration files and the zone contents. The name server process is assumed to be already running.

section.title: Dispose of the Old Zone Key
section.para: Delete the old ZSK's .private and .key files.

section.title: Restart Automatic Zone Rollover
section.para: Automatic rollover may be restarted by executing the rollerd command. It should be given the same options as when it was originally started.

section.title: Manual Emergency Rollover of Current and Published ZSKs
section.para: The steps given below detail the actions needed for emergency rollover of the Current and Published ZSKs.

section.title: Generate New Current and Published ZSKs
section.para: Follow the steps in Section ??? in order to generate two ZSK. Update the Key-Tag Table with the new ZSKs; replace the existing set of ZSKs with the new values.

section.title: Modify the Zone File
section.para: The zone file must be modified to account for the key changes. The Current and Published ZSKs must be replaced with the new keys. Also, the SOA serial number must be incremented so that the zone file's new contents will be recognized.

The required key changes are made by modifying the $INCLUDE lines at the end of the file. The $INCLUDE line for the Current and Published ZSKs must be deleted and replaced with $INCLUDE lines for the new ZSKs.

section.title: Sign the Zone with the KSK and Current ZSK
section.para: Follow the steps in sections ??? - ??? if the zone does no delegation. Follow the steps in sections ??? - ??? if the zone does delegation. The ZSK used in the signing process in ??? or ??? must be the key that is marked as the Current key (C) in the Key-Tag table. The KSK used as input to dnssec-signzone does not change, so the keyset does not change and does not have to be re-sent to the parent.

section.title: Reload the Zone
section.para: The rndc will reload the name server configuration files and the zone contents. The name server process is assumed to be already running.

section.para: Delete the old ZSK's .private and .key files.
